availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Clinton Bowen Fisk (St. Louis, Missouri, Brevet Major General (U.S.A.))

body.p: St. Louis, Missouri, brevet major general (U.S.A.). Clapp's Corner, New York, native. Son of Benjamin Fisk and Lydia Fisk. Married to Jenette C. Fisk. Father of Charles A. Fisk and May C. Fisk. Served in the 33rd Missouri Volunteer Regiment (U.S.A.) as colonel from September 5, 1862 to August 8, 1862. Commissioned brigadier general on August 8, 1862. Appointed to serve in the Missouri Militia as major general on February 27, 1865. Served in the United States Volunteers as brevet major-general from May 13, 1865, to May 18, 1865. Assistant commissioner of the Bureau of Refugees, Freedmen, and Abandoned Lands (Freedmenâ€™s Bureau) from May 1865 to June 1866.
